intro: Camissonia walkeri subsp. tortilis, commonly known as the twisted camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The subspecies tortilis is distinguished by its twisted, coiled stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny habitats. This plant is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to coastal climates with mild temperatures and moderate rainfall.
